results.name: Period 3: repeat [1, 1, -2].
comment: WARNING: It is unclear whether this sequence should start at offset 1 (as written) or offset 0 (in analogy to many similar sequences, which seems to be assumed in many of the given formulas).
Inverse binomial transform of A057079. - _Paul Barry_, May 15 2003
The unsigned version, with g.f. (1 + x + 2*x^2)/(1 - x^3), has a(n) = 4/3 -cos(2*Pi*n/3)/3 - sqrt(3)*sin(2*Pi*n/3)/3 = gcd(Fib(n+4), Fib(n+1)). - _Paul Barry_, Apr 02 2004
a(n) = L(n-2,-1), where L is defined as in A108299; see also A010892 for L(n,+1). - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Jun 01 2005

From the Taylor expansion of log(1 + x + x^2) at x = 1, Sum_{k > 0} a(k)/k = log(3) = A002391. This is case n = 3 of the general expression Sum_{k > 0} (1-n*!(k mod n))/k = log(n). - _Jaume Oliver Lafont_, Oct 16 2009
If used with offset zero, a non-simple continued fraction representation of 2+sqrt(2). - _R. J. Mathar_, Mar 08 2012

Periodic sequences of this type can be also calculated by a(n) = c + floor(q/(p^m-1)*p^n) mod p, where c is a constant, q is the number representing the periodic digit pattern and m is the period length. c, p and q can be calculated as follows: Let D be the array representing the number pattern to be repeated, m = size of D, max = maximum value of elements in D, min = minimum value of elements in D. Than c := min, p := max - min + 1 and q := p^m*Sum_{i=1..m} (D(i)-min)/p^i. Example: D = (1, 1, -2), c = -2, p = 4 and q = 60 for this sequence. - _Hieronymus Fischer_, Jan 04 2013
This is the Dirichlet inverse of A117997. - _Petros Hadjicostas_, Jul 25 2020

formula: With offset zero, a(n) = A057079(2n). a(n) = -a(n-1) - a(n-2) with a(0) = a(1) = 1.
a(n) = -(n mod 3) + (n+1) mod 3. - _Paolo P. Lava_, Oct 20 2006
Dirichlet g.f.: zeta(s)*(1-1/3^(s-1)). - _R. J. Mathar_, Feb 09 2011
a(n) = n * Sum_{k=1..n} binomial(k,n-k)/k*(-1)^(k+1). - _Dmitry Kruchinin_, Jun 03 2011
a(n) = a(n-3) for n > 3. - _Wesley Ivan Hurt_, Jul 01 2016
a(n) = A000032(n) - A007040(n), for n > 1. - _Wojciech Florek_, Feb 20 2018

xref: Apart from signs, same as A057079, A100063. Cf. A000045, A010892 for the rules a(n) = a(n - 1) + a(n - 2), a(n) = a(n - 1) - a(n - 2). a(n) = - a(n - 1) + a(n - 2) gives a signed version of Fibonacci numbers.
